newsitem.title: SURINAM: Surinam pyramid scheme victims march on legislature.
newsitem.headline: Surinam pyramid scheme victims march on legislature.

text.p: More than 100 angry Surinamese investors marched on the National Assembly on Monday to demand government help after losing their shirts in the collapse of a pyramid banking scheme.
"If nobody wants to do something about this case, we'll force them to do something because people are suffering," depositors action group representative Kenneth Moenne said.
The savings scheme, which relied on ever increasing numbers of depositors to pay off earlier investors, crashed two weeks ago when the largest operation, run by Roep NV, suspended payments.
Many investors had borrowed heavily to put money into the savings scheme, lured by interest rates of up to 120 percent a year, compared to 20 percent offered by local banks.

Moenne said 3,000 investors had so far signed the action group's petition, but that around 10,000 were affected in the failed get-rich-quick scheme which resembles a similar one that crashed in Albania in April, sparking a political crisis.
